raw_comment:
I noticed that applicants who come from a higher income background and have a legacy status have higher chances of acceptance into the universities. 
I wonder how this process affects the acceptance rates of applicants who come from a lower income background and also without a legacy status. 
This relates to my community and I because we share the same belief that the acceptance process should have an equal chance for all applicants, no matter their financial background or legacy status. 
My catchy headline for the graph is "Prepare for the Unfair Truth Behind College Admissions".
